lead_paragraph: Chargers linebacker Steve Foley was apparently unarmed when Aaron Mansker, an off-duty Coronado (Calif.) police officer, shot him early Sunday near Foley’s suburban home, the authorities said yesterday. “To my knowledge, I don’t believe Foley did have a weapon, even though I was told he reached into his waistband with his right hand,” San Diego County sheriff’s Lt. Dennis Brugos said. On Monday, Foley’s agent, David Levine, said Foley was in stable condition. The shooting occurred after Mansker followed a suspected drunken driver.
